11512222111.content:
Ranma couldn't believe this. That idiot was proposing to Akane? Right in front of his mother?

He could fight Ryouga right now, although Nodoka wouldn't approve of "Ranko" acting like that, even if it was in defense of Ranma's fiancé. Still, it couldn't be helped. There was no way he was letting Ryouga get away with this. No one took his uncute fiancé like that!

In the petite form of Ranko, she stomped towards Ryouga, all too ready to deck him right then and there. Ryouga glared back, although a trace of fear reflected in his eyes. Ha! She'd prove that navigationally-inept Ryouga that he was right to be scared!

Ryouga's mind was whirling. Ranma was heading right for him, Ranma was heading right for him. It should be Akane but it's Ranma, why is it Ranma it CAN'T be Ranma.

To every martial artist's shock and horror, "Ranko" suddenly kissed Ryouga right on the lips.

"What is he doing?!" thought everyone except Nodoka in horror.

"What am I doing?!" internally screamed Ranma.

"Ranko" pulled back, a giant grin on her face, hands clasped girlishly together.

"Of course, Ryouga! I'd happily marry you! I love you more than anyone in the world."

And with the wish fulfilled, Ranko's grin slipped from her face, eyes bugged out in shock and disgust, while Ryouga buried his face in his own hands.

The happy couple.
11512222111.title: Ranko

choices: Ranma and Ryouga are too honorable to call off the wedding
115122221112.content:
A hand slowly reached to cover Ranko's own mouth in surprise. "I-I didn't... I wouldn't- what..."

Unable to stop stammering, the girl quickly ran from the room. Ryouga sputtered in complete bafflement.

Akari stood up first. "I understand. I won't get in the way of you too." She struggled to get the words out, tears in her eyes, before racing from the Tendo dojo.

"Akari wai-" Before Ryouga could chase after her, he was quickly tackled by the furious Amazon and the enraged baker.

"What spell on Ranma?"

"What kinda trick are ya pulling on Ranma, huh Sugar?"

"N-no I swear, there must be some mistake!" He couldn't believe it. He just couldn't believe it!"

"H-he's right! Ranma isn't even here, so there couldn't be any kind of trick!" The two girls turned at Akane in confusion, only to see her gesturing to Nodoka pointedly.

Oh right. The suicide pact. That was a thing.

The two gave Ryouga dirty looks before lifting themselves off of Ryouga.

"Right. Course. Just got so eager ta make sure this was a good match." A glare of pure rage at Ryouga.

"Many love potions in Amazon. Want to be sure Ranko union pure." A gaze full of hatred.

"Oh dear. That does seem like a dangerous thing. Will Ranko be alright?" Nodoka bought the vague and confusing excuses, hook line and sinker.

"Ryouga would never do that." The wonderful Akane, always making sure he was okay.

"R-right! I mean, I might have wished to find my soulmate but that doesn't mean-"

"WHAT?!" Three voices of shock, including the wonderful Akane with a distinctly displeased look on her face.

"Oh, how sweet. It seems you and Ranko are the perfect match then!"

Ryouga chose to run far far away rather than continue this conversation. Even with the shouts behind him, all he could focus on was putting distance between himself and the dojo.

It was fitting that, eventually, his poor direction would lead him right into a punch.

"The hell was that, you doofus?!"

Ugh. Ranma. Still a girl. "Me?! What about you, rambling about love and all that?!" Ranma always ruined everything!

"How should I know?! What I do know is that it all started with your stupid confession!"

Ryouga glared, rising to his feet. He figured it out. Ranma did this on purpose. "You heard me make my wish, didn't you?"

"What?!"

"That's right, you heard me wish for my soulmate to marry me and decided to play a joke! I should've known you'd be so cruel!"

Ranma's brow furrowed. A wish? Is that was caused this? Then did that mean...

...No, there was a better explanation. Something that made sense, he thought with a rising smirk.

"I just wanted to make sure a lousy creep like you didn't marry Akane!" There was no way Ryouga was his soulmate, Ranma rationalized. Therefore, he only said those things to make sure nothing came from Ryouga's proposal.

The cursed pig grimaced. "You bastard...!"

That rotten Ranma! Always ruining his happiness. There was no way they could be soulmates!
115122221112.title: Ranma and Ryouga quickly race off to yell

choices: "That my soulmate and I enjoy a loving date right now!"
1151222211121.content:
Ryouga pointed at Ranma dramatically. "You may have interrupted my wish with your scheming, but I know it'll come true! The ring of truth will unite me with my soulmate and I'll finally get what I deserve!"

Ranma rolled her eyes, placing her hands on her hips mockingly. "More magic? C'mon Ryouga, that stuff always blows up in your face. And it's pretty clear that this time, it didn't even work!"

The lost boy's teeth mashed. "I'll show you, Ranma! I'll prove the power of the Ring of Truth!"

He raised his hand into the air, putting the ring back on his finger, ready to dramatically declare his desire to the ring once again.

"Ring! I wish...."
1151222211121.title: Ryouga makes another Truth

choices: The date continues, for better or for worse
At the end of the date, they come to their senses
11512222111211.content:
Truth based magical items tend to be quite literal. Ryoga had already "wished" to be on a date, but that didn't make it true that he was on a date. It was just true that he wanted to be on the date. Very little change

So at first, it seemed like nothing happened. That bastard Ranma sneered. "Some wishing ring, huh?"

Despair wrapped Ryoga like a blanket. He didn't understand. Anything he said with this ring came true, right? "I don't understand! I should be on a loving date with my real fiancé right now!"

And then everything changed.

With the blink of an eye, Ryoga found himself by a lake, sprawled on a blanket in the grass. He shook his head in puzzlement. Shouldn't he be somewhere else right now? He couldn't quite recall. It almost hurt to recall.

Ranko was going through a similar predicament. She had been arguing with someone, hadn't she? She vaguely remembered anger and fighting and mocking. But trying to think about those feelings just left her mind in a deep fog. Why the arguing and yelling?

For reasons Ryoga and Ranko couldn't understand, all they felt like being right now was "loving".

Their eyes meet and bright smiles lighten up their faces.

"Oh darling... I'm so happy to be enjoying such a wonderful picnic." Ranko's method of being loving to her fiancé wasn't all that different from how a disguised Ranma would wrap Ryoga around "her" finger. Lots of flattery and promises of love.

Ryoga blushed. "You- you really mean it?"

"Of course, Ryoga! I can't think of a better way to spend my afternoon than with my handsome betrothed.

Wow! Ryoga couldn't believe it. The ring had given him a beautiful, kind woman to spend a happy marriage with. For all the misery in his life, something finally went his way.

Thank goodness there wasn't any twist.
11512222111211.title: "That my soulmate and I enjoy a loving date...

choices: Ryoga is wrangled into staying for Dinner
Another 'truth' is made on the ring/Something else
115122221112112.content:
The date that followed went swimmingly.

Picturesque.

Enough to make the real Ranma and Ryoga want to puke.

'Ranko' and him through it all spent their time hand-feeding each other light snacks, as they basked in the warm afternoon sun. They walked around the lake, and held hands while enjoying the scenery. If by fate, or design of the ring, the bandana-clad boy never once managed to utter a 'truth' that disrupted their good time, with only asking for the occasional flair to enhance things: a flower to place in 'Ranko's' hair, a few yen to buy ice cream. It was so mundane, that it came off almost surreal in the outlandish chaos that was typical in Nerima.

Throughout it all, there was a slight nagging in the two's minds that something was terribly, awfully wrong, but both quashed it as quickly as could be. All that was important was that 'Ranko' was with her beloved husband-to-be, while Ryoga finally had someone who accepted him for who he was.

This went on for several hours, as the midday weather eventually started to fade into dusk. However reluctant they were, at the first sign of a shiver, Ryoga offered to take his fiancee home.

Granted, this more amounted to Ranko guiding Royga arm in arm back to the dojo, but that sense of protective duty despite his directional foibles was what she found so cute about him.

Of course though, this was a 'loving date,' and what better way to symbolize that, then to end it all with a passionate kiss?

Upon walking up to the Tendo gates, the two, still tightly woven under the magic Ryoga's 'truth,' turned to each other. There was a slight bashfulness in both of them, but an equal twinkle of longing in their eyes. Ryoga was the first to instigate, as he cupped at his girlfriend's cheek. Ranko leaned in, rising up to her tiptoes; her masculine lover always towering over her petite form.

Soon their eyes closed, as their faces drew inches away. For the second time that day they were about to embrace, and it felt as natural and right as anything else in the world.

A spark lit between the two as their lips met, and for a wonderful moment, they were together as one.

...Until Ranma wondered just what the hell she was doing.

*click*

“Uh huh, I think I should make a portrait out of this one.” Nabiki spoke, as the flash of her camera tapered off.

“Oh my, Ranko! This is so sweet. I always knew you'd find a boyfriend!” Came the jubilant voice of Nodoka, as she clasped her hands together.

“Fiance, Mrs. S. She did agree to it.” Nabiki corrected.

“R- Ranko, we were worried... You've been gone for hours.” Akane had an annoyed twitch on her face, but nevertheless kept the charade up.

“We were just about to go looking for you, sugar.” Ukyo's tone was even, but her eyes were zeroed in on the sight of her currently female 'fiance' locking lips with a man. Suddenly the idea of practicing her breast-bindings again, and dusting off her boys school uniform, wasn't sounding like the craziest idea. “Shampoo already did.”

The Amazon left only a few minutes after Ranma and Ryoga had. With experience of tracking the redhead across all of China, she thought she'd be able to catch the two quick, but the magic of the ring inhibited her from interfering, and instead led the girl on a wild goose chase that she was still lost on.

Ranma could only thank the little blessings. This, and the fathers being away on a 'training trip,' helped make her not totally want to melt into a puddle and die.

Worse for Ryoga was the tingling he still felt on his lips. The past few hours were an odd blur for him, but the normally dark and depressive aura that surrounded him seemed to be... lessened. Like, for just a moment, he was happy.

The fact that Ranma might have caused him to be happy was terrifying.

“Dinner's ready!” Kasumi chirped, as she walled over to where all the commotion was. “Oh, Ranko. You're back!” She paused. “I like the flower in your hair.”
115122221112112.title: An Abridged Date

choices: "Ranko" takes a subtle approach and manages to get the ring
Ranma is too obvious and something goes wrong
1151222211121121.content:
In his horrified daze, Ryoga allows Kasumi and Nodoka to move him inside. Nabiki followed, already volunteering her experience services for the ceremony. She'd conned her way into various professions including priesthood, a wedding was no trouble. Their words of recitals and love vows and flower girls attempt to reach Ryoga's brain, only to encounter a harsh wall of denial. This couldn't be happening. This couldn't possibly be happening.

Ranko was too absorbed in her own bafflement to join him. Hands combed her dress carefully, feeling the soft fabric of her girlish outfit. How in the hell had he been shoved into this get-up? And what was he doing with Ryoga?

"Raaaanmaaaa..." the familiar, dangerous tone of an angry Akane spoke to him from the pit of horror he found himself in. "You aren't manipulating Ryoga again, are you? You wouldn't do that <i>right?</i>"

Ranma's mouth desperately fumbled for a defense. He's not a pervert, and what does that have to do with an uncute girl like you. The typical things that got him beat up.

But this time, Ranma's fingers curled around the flower in her hair. Puzzled, she pulled it out to examine it closer.

"...What's this." A strange mumble.

"Ranma answer the question!"

"Where did I get this?"

Akane's rage was directed to the flower. "What? How should I know?!"

"Looks like ya date gave it to ya, sugar." A bitter retort from Ukyo.

The brain refused to understand. Even with his memories and evidence, he refused to grasp it.

"Date?"

The two finances paused, glancing at each other warily. Ranma could be dumb, but this was something else.

"...Yeah... with Ryoga? That's what happened, right?"

Date. With Ryoga.

The flower was crushed in Ranma's hand.

"I'm gonna kill him."

Ukyo didn't understand in time but Akane immediately went to work throwing herself between Ranma and the door.

"Ranma, don't you dare!"

"Him and his stupid ring, Akane!" The anger was pushing through Ranma's mouth like a stampede over Mufasa. "It's all his fault and he's gonna pay for it!"

Lightbulb.

"The wish ring. That's it!" The anger shifted to glee as she pushed past Akane. "I just gotta get the ring!"

"Wha- Ranma!" But he couldn't hear his fiancé over sheer desperation and a need for solutions.

11513111.content:
Ranma groaned in irritation as his father was knocked into the pond. He'd set up a whole personal training regime for himself; forty crunches, forty push-ups, forty, sit-ups, and so on until he completed all his exercises. But Pops kept popping in to brawl and making him lose his focus. Couldn't he enjoy one routine in the Tendo garden without anyone distracting him?

With a sigh, he knelt down next to a patch of flowers and restarted the routine. One, two, three, four...

An unnoticed change.

...seven, eight, nine, ten! One flower for each class she had ever shared with Kuno.

Ranma smelled the daisies with a small smile. Yes, this would be perfect. She'd present them to Kuno tomorrow, find a place alone to talk... and then she'd finally confess! After all these years, she was finally going to work up the courage to tell the swordsman how she felt. She was blushing just thinking about it!

"Kasumi! Is it all right if I take these?"
11513111.title: The ring affects Ranma

115132.content: Perhaps Happosai has the ring?
115132.title: nope (Thank God!) someone else

1151322.content: How about a female character, such as Akane?
1151322.title: ARE YOU CRAZY?!

11513221.content:
It was just after school and Akane was walking home. A stray thought, caused by some conversation at school she already forgot about made her think about certain things. Specifically, of Ranma, of Shampoo, of Ukyo, of Kodachi, of Happosai, of many more as her mind leaped from person to person. She didn't exactly hate them (okay, she didn't hate ALL of them), but she did hate how they all complicated her once simple life. That was when she tripped over something and fell in some mud.

After grumbling for a bit, Akane turned to see what tripped her and found a small, plain, white box. Curiosity overtaking her, Akane opened it up. Inside was a piece of paper and a small silver ring with a light blue gem in the center. The paper read,

THE RING OF TRUTH

Whoever wears this Ring, their words will become law.

The Ring of Truth binds itself to the one who discovers it and puts it on, so that none but the wearer can remove it. Whenever the wearer pictures the Ring in their mind and speaks, reality itself will conform to the wearer's wishes.

May you use this awesome gift wisely.

Akane picked up the ring and slipped it onto her left ring finger. Her first instinct was to scoff at what seemed like an obvious trick, but she thought back to the many, MANY magical items she encountered in her life, so she figured she might as well give it a shot.

Akane looked down at her muddy dress. It was good enough a test as any. "This dress is now clean," Akane said uncertainly.

Nothing. The dress was still dirty. Just her luck to run into a fake ring and-

Wait. The paper said to picture the ring in her mind. And she didn't think she did that. Okay, just one more test.

"This dress is now clean." Akane made sure to imagine the ring's appearance as she spoke. To her amazement, the dress went from covered in mud to completely spotless in the blink of an eye.

"Wow. I didn't think that would actually work." She considered just how powerful this trinket was, and how amazingly fortunate she was to run into it (almost literally). She didn't know what this ring's limitations were, if it even had any, but that didn't make it any less impressive.

A grin formed on Akane's face. She knew just what to do with this find.
11513221.title: Akane

choices: "What? No you're not." (The changes are applied to the present.)
"You're strong, but not THAT strong. (The ring alters history.)
115132211.content:
Akane hated Ranma's attitude at times, always acting like he's so much stronger and better than her. Besides, her life started getting weird once he showed up, and he was kinda-sorta the cause of all the disturbances in her life. She'd always wanted to put him in his place, and now she had the tool to do so.

Akane made her way to the Tendo residence, managing to get there before Ranma did. Once Ranma did get there, he saw Akane leaning on a post at the front of the dojo, her arms crossed.

"Hello, Ranma."

"Uh, hi, Akane," Ranma said, a bit absently. From her pose to the smile on her face, Akane just emanated a feeling of... smugness? That was odd. Ranma was about to ask Akane about that when he saw a ring on her finger.

"Hey, what's up with that ring? I never saw you wearing it before."

Akane figured he would notice, so she already had a lie prepared. "Oh, this? There was a guy on the street hawking jewelry at a hefty markdown. I got this one for about 500 yen."

"Uh huh." He was sceptical of her explanation, but he wasn't quite sure why.

"Anyway," said Akane, "I've been getting a bit bored lately. I was thinking, say... a sparring match would be one way to pass the time."

Ranma looked perplexed at what Akane suggested. "A sparring match? Is that really the best way to cure your boredom? I mean, no offense, but I'd totally kick your ass."

Most days, that would be enough to make her pissed off, but not today. With a smirk, she said, "Oh really? You'd kick my ass? That's odd, given how I'm the strongest a person could possibly be."

Akane didn't see it, but the ring's gem glistened once she finished her statement. But Akane didn't need to see it. While everything around her seemed the same as it had always been, she could just FEEL reality bending to her words. She smirk widened even further, as she was so excited at the power she held in her hand.

Once she heard Ranma's response to her claim, she would learn more about how this ring worked. Ranma said...
115132211.title: Visit Ranma

1151322112.content:
Ranma shook his head. "Look, I'm not gonna lie, you're a pretty strong girl." Ranma knew that she was stronger than him, but he wasn't going to admit that out loud. "But you're still giving yourself way too much credit."

Akane pondered on what she had just done. Cleaning a dress was one thing, but this was quite another. If Ranma admitted how strong she was, she must be pretty strong indeed. More importantly, Ranma didn't seem at all confused when she said how powerful she was. So not only did the Ring of Truth alter reality, it altered HISTORY. "That means I make any changes I want and nobody will notice," Akane thought. She felt like there was literally nothing she couldn't accomplish.

"Uh, Akane, you alright?"

That snapped Akane out of her train of thought. "Huh? Oh, yes. I was just thinking about some things. Anyway, are you still open to sparring with me?"

"Hmph. Of course I am. Why wouldn't I be?" Ranma spoke with bravado, possibly a false one.

"Great! I'll meet you at the practice hall in ten minutes."

Ten minutes later, the two combatants faced each other in the practice hall, Akane in her karate gi and Ranma in the same clothes he had before. Both people performed the customary bow and got into their stances.

Akane thought, "Hmm, I have no idea just how strong I am now. But what would be the best way to test that? Maybe if I-". Her thoughts were cut short when she noticed that Ranma already had his arms around her neck. Just a few seconds into the spar and she was already in a standing neck lock.

"Dammit, " thought Akane, "how could I've let my guard down?... Huh?" Ranma was trying to force Akane down to the floor, but to no avail. Eyes closed, teeth clenched, he was clearly using all his might, but her body refused to budge a centimeter. "Heh, this'll be even easier than I thought."

Akane tensed her neck, sending Ranma to the ground so hard you would think he got hit by a car. As Ranma was rubbing his back in pain, Akane laughed. "I did barely anything and you're already on the mat! Ready to give up?"

Ranma got to his feet and said, "You really think I'm gonna give up after just one attack?"

Akane shrugged her shoulders. "Not really, but it was worth a shot. You know what, you might have gotten the first attack off, but I'm feeling generous, so you can have the second one for free as well."

Ranma grumbled as he saw Akane's smirk, the very definition of a shit-eating grin. The same goddamn grin she she had every time they fought. What he wouldn't give to wipe it off her face. "Seriously? You're gonna regret that!"

Faster than Akane could see, Ranma leaped up to Akane and started punching. It was a flurry of punches, hundreds of them per second. To Akane, they were completely invisible, but she did feel and hear them. They felt like a bunch of flies landing on her torso in quick succession and sounded like a hammer repeatedly hitting a steel wall. She smiled. Her body must be the toughest thing on Earth!

Akane put her hands on her hips and laughed. "Really Ranma, don't you get it? There's no way you can beat me! Any attack you use will simply bounce right off my immovable body! Why, I bet my toes are stronger than your entire body! Don't you remember how many times you've fought me - and lost?" Akane had no idea how many times that was, but she knew that Ranma did.
"Shut up! Just shut up and let me beat you!"

Akane rolled her eyes at Ranma's outburst. Ranma was sweating pretty heavily from the exertion, but Akane knew that he could keep that up for at least a few minutes more, and she wanted to finish demonstrating her newfound superiority.

Acting as quick as she could, Akane brought her right foot up to Ranma's chest and pushed him to the mat. Soon, Ranma found himself with his back on the floor, Akane's dainty foot keeping him pinned down. He struggled a bit, only for Akane to exert a tiny bit more of her tremendous might, making him cry out in agonizing pain. Akane heard some bones creaking, but she didn't think it was anything serious.

"Ha! You sure talk a big game, but you can't even move one of my feet!" Akane moved her left foot onto Ranma's stomach so that she was standing completely on him, making Ranma cry out even more. "Keep in mind, I'm going easy on you. Tell you what: admit that I'm the strongest person on Earth and we can end this without any broken bones."

"No way am I giving up to a tomboy like you." Ranma was still predictable as ever.

In response, Akane brought her left leg over her head, held it there for a moment while giving a smirk, then suddenly brought it down towards Ranma's head. Ranma flinched, but Akane only brought her foot to right in front of his chin, her toes curled inwards.

"Ranma, Ranma. I've tried to be nice, but this is my final warning. Admit my superiority and I won't uncurl my toes."

Ranma gulped despite the ridiculousness of her threat, as if this exact situation has happened before. He took a deep breath and said, "You-you are the strongest person who ever lived. No one could ever be half as strong as you. I could train for a hundred years and still be weaker than your pinky."

Akane smiled. It looked like she did do this sort of thing in this reality. "Very good." She hopped off of Ranma's torso.

Ranma got up to his feet, said, "Hmph", and walked out the room without looking back at Akane. Akane, for her part, loved what happened. She loved being able to dominate Ranma for, and so easily at that. She loved finding the Ring of Truth. Now, she just needed to figure out what to do now. She was nearly overwhelmed by the options the ring gave her.
1151322112.title: The Ring Alters History

choices: She plays with the ring a bit more.
11513221122.content:
Being super strong was one thing, but there was so much more to learn about this ring and what it could do. Might as well test it some more now.

"I am now in my room." There was no flash of light, no swirling colors, no stepping into the fifth dimension. All that happened was that one second she was in the practice room, the next she was in her bedroom.

What immediately caught her eye were a few photos on her bookshelf that weren't there before. Most of them showed her at various martial arts tournaments, wearing a gi and holding trophies (hopefully, the trophies were kept in another part of the house). But one was different in that it showed a young Akane in casual clothes, standing on top of a bear she apparently just beat up and giving a double biceps pose. It didn't give a good impression of how strong she was now, but it was still impressive and testing her strength could come later.

Looking down at her gi, Akane said, "I'm in my everyday clothes". Not only was that now true, but she opened her dresser and found her gi where normally put it.

"Hmm, there's not much else I can do in such a small room. Better go to where there's more space."

Come to think of it, she hadn't seen Ukyo in a while and wondered how she was doing. So after thinking carefully about what to say, she said, "I'm at Okonomiyaki Ucchan’s, but no one notices me teleporting there". Sure enough, she was suddenly at the restaurant, but everyone around her acted as if nothing out of the ordinary happened. For some reason, there was a long table with a bunch of seats on one side in the middle of the room.

Akane saw Ukyo in the distance and ran up to her. "Hey, Ukyo."

Ukyo turned around. "Oh hey, Akane. What brings you here?"

"Nothing much. But I was wondering why that table's over there."

Ukyo clapped her hands together. "I was waiting for you to ask that. Okonomiyaki Ucchan’s received its 10,000th customer just a few days ago and I decided to celebrate with an eating contest!"

"An eating contest, huh?" Shoving food down your throat wasn't the most refined or feminine thing in the world, but it could still be fun. "Can I join?"

"You? Er, I mean, you can, but you do know this isn't the sort of contest where brute strength is gonna help much, right? I've never even seen you get all that hungry."

In response, Akane pictured the Ring of Truth in her head and replied, "Oh, I'm not just super strong, and I may not be hungrier than anyone else, but I'm a total beast at competitive eating! In fact, I can outeat every student at Furinkan High School at the same time and still have room for more - and no matter how much I eat, I never get even slightly fat!" That last part was a hasty edition. Otherwise, this wish could have nasty consequences.

"Our entire high school?! That's a bit hard to believe." She then started to stroke her chin in thought. "Then again, I remember seeing you wolf down that entire banquet - and in less than half a minute, at that! So... I don’t think there’s any way you could lose!”

Akane smiled warmly at her friend's encouragement, but then Ukyo snapped her fingers and said, "Damn, I forgot!"

"Er, forgot what?" Akane hoped it was nothing serious. Then again, Akane could easily deal with pretty much any problem.

"That the deadline for signing up was last night."

Akane was, to be honest, a tad annoyed, but she realized it wasn't really Ukyo's fault that she forgot. Besides, it wasn't like there wasn't an easy fix to this.

"Well then, it's a good thing I signed up a few days ago."

“Sure is! I’d hate for you to miss out on this!”

Later, Akane sat at the table, wearing a special shirt that all contestants had to wear. Strangely, the table was at full capacity – seven people – but there were a couple dozen other people wearing the contestant shirts standing in a corner of the room.
Ukyo stood in front of the table and gave a speech to the audience. “Welcome to Okonomiyaki Ucchan’s first ever eating contest! The rules are simple: eat more than your opponents, and you win. However, this eating contest will do things a bit different from other contests.” Everyone’s ears perked up at Ukyo’s words. “This contest received a huge number of applicants – 37!” In fact, not that many people signed up before Akane did. Once word got out that she applied to a local eating competition, a few meatheads signed up, hoping to defeat “The Furinkan Wunderkind” in at least something. Ukyo continued, “We thought it would be a shame to turn these people away, so we came up with a way to take advantage of the large number of applicants. Instead of having all contestants eat at the same time, whenever a contestant can no longer eat, they are replaced with the next person in line. Additionally, if anyone other than Miss Akane Tendo wins, the prize money will be paid in full to all 36 other contestants!” Akane turned her head to Ukyo in surprise. She didn’t remember being told that this was how the contest would be set up. But before she could even say “wait, what?”, Ukyo announced the start of the contest.

Plates of food were placed down in front of each contestant. Most of it was okonomiyaki, but there were also dishes of yakisoba and scallions. Akane took one plate in front of her and devoured it in less than a second, the food just going down her throat, barely needing to be chewed. She took a large bowl of noodles and downed it just as quickly. The same went for her third, fourth, fifth, and sixth dishes. Akane knew that her previous words made her the best competitive eater by far, but she didn’t give it too much thought, so she didn’t truly expect to be able to eat food this quickly.

She was certainly eating much faster than her opponents. By the time the runner-up was reaching for his fourth plate, Akane already had twenty plates and a dozen bowls stacked up in front of her. Soon, a contestant passed out, followed by another, and then some more. Some of the competitors had wide smiles plastered on their faces, thinking that they had finally trapped Akane in a fight she couldn’t win, only for those smiles to turn to frowns, partly from the realization of how bottomless Akane’s stomach was, and partly because they were about to throw up. Meanwhile, Akane never showed the slightest sign of slowing down.
After what felt like forever, Akane’s final opponent finally passed out. Upon seeing this, Ukyo made her way to Akane’s seat. It was tricky, as Akane ate so much that there was no room on the table for the countless dishes she used, so most of them had to be placed on the floor around her. When she got to her, Ukyo raised Akane’s arm and shouted, “The winner is… AKANE TENDO!” To the audience, it was clear that Akane would win right around when her fifteenth opponent collapsed, but they clapped all the same.

After the audience left, and the contestants were carried away, Ukyo spoke with Akane. “That was amazing! But I just knew you could do it. Anyway, do you want your prize money in cash or…”

“You know what? You can keep the money. I don’t really need it that much.” In truth, Akane was more interested in seeing what the ring could do than using it for money. “But why pit me against dozens of other guys? You never told me you’d do that.”

Ukyo blinked in response. “What do you mean? We both agreed on this back when you signed up.”

“…Oh yeah, now I remember. I guess I just forgot.” That’s the problem with using a magic ring that changes history: you never remember the new history you’ve just created.

Ukyo thought it was odd that she would just forget about something like that, but she just accepted that it was possible. Instead, she gazed at Akane’s belly, still flat as ever despite Akane having eaten ¾ of the food eaten at this contest. “It must be nice to have a metabolism like yours”, she practically mumbled.

Fortunately, Akane could see what Ukyo was implying, and smiled as she said, “Really? I’ve never seen you fat. Most likely it’s impossible for you to get fat.” She very well leave without giving her friend a gift, especially given how easy it was to give.

“You got that right. Guess I just have good genes, like you apparently do.”

Akane said goodbye and left Okonomiyaki Ucchan’s, where she saw that it was now nighttime. That contest must have taken longer than she thought. It was probably a good idea to go home now. Then again, she might have just enough time for a little bit more fun with the ring.
11513221122.title: She Tests Out the Ring

115132211221.content:
Akane felt that this was enough for one night and simply walked home. Once she got there, she found that everyone was already asleep, so she was able to quickly make her way to her room.

Akane changed into her pajamas and lifted the bed’s covers when she caught a glimpse of the Ring of Truth. She held her left hand closer to get a good look at it, not to see any particular detail, but to remind herself that such an object actually existed. Sure, she had encountered her fair share of magical items, but nothing was half as miraculous as the ring she had around her finger. In a way, it reminded her of the Battle Dogi, only far more potent.

That stray thought of the Battle Dogi made her realize something. Many such items seem wonderful at first but carry some hideous drawback such as a time limit, or it drives the user insane, or – worst of all – it gives you facial hair. This ring seemed like one of the greatest gifts she could ever receive, but maybe she quit while she’s ahead, toss away the ring and forget about it.

She debated with herself for a while until she started yawning. Yes, it was better to just fall asleep. Perhaps tomorrow’s Akane will manage to figure this out.
115132211221.title: She goes home

12531121.content:
One day, while hiding out in the Fire Nation, Katara was visiting the local market place. Nothing really interested her as it all looked like junk anyway but then she saw the ring. It was more beautiful than anything she had ever seen and there seemed to be a kind of aura about it that drew her in. The salesman noticed and a crooked grin crossed his face. "Ah, I see you've found the Ring of Truth" he said in an oily voice "forged in the days before even the First Avatar, it has to the power to make the words of whoever wears it come true."

Katara raised an eyebrow at that, the ring's spell on her temporarily wearing off. "Yeah right" she scoffed "if that's true, then why are you still a merchant? Why not use the ring to make yourself a king or something?"

"The ring is useless to one who already has what his heart desires" the salesman chuckled "but you look like a person with secret wishes in their soul. You've lost someone very dear to you in recent years haven't you? Your mother right? I believe her name was Kya?"

Katara's eyes widened and the salesman chuckled again. "Don't be alarmed" he said "one of the things I did ask of the ring was to know all about my customers the minute I see them. I know the Avatar is alive and you're his traveling companion. I also know you seek to end the war and with the ring, you can do just that."

"I-I don't have any money left" Katara stammered "I just remembered but I believe you now, I have to! I'll give you anything for it!"

The salesman chucked once more and held the ring out. "put it on" he instructed "and want for nothing." Katara did as she was told and was amazed at how well it fit. "Now" instructed the salesman again "use the ring to pay me."

The waterbender was a bit confused at first then suddenly, knowledge came to her. "My pouch has an endless supply of money" she said confidently and an instant later, it was so. Katara pulled out a handful of coins and a big grin crossed her tan face. It actually worked!

Katara gave the salesman a thousand coins and he smiled greedily. "Pleasure doing business with you" he said before he and his stand vanished into thin air. Katara was a bit surprised but quickly got over it. Right now, nothing was impossible.

1451.content:
Long ago in the Enchanted Forest, Rumplestiltskin made one of his infamous deals to acquire the Ring of Truth, known for it's ability to mold reality to it's user's wims by words alone. With it, the Dark Wizard would not only be able to bring his son back from the Land Without Magic but become invincible! But fate intervened when the mysterious Sorcerer sent his Apprentice to get the ring from him. Though Rumplestiltskin's powers far out matched the Apprentice, the Sorcerer's disciple succeeded in sending the Ring through a portal across time and space, to a very distant land. He was also able to erase Rumplestiltskin's memory of not only their battle, but the Ring's very existence!

Hundreds of years later, the Evil Queen cast the Dark curse. The entire population of the Enchanted Forest and then some was sent to the Land without Magic. It was there that they would be trapped in the town of Storybrooke, Maine, their memories taken and forced to live miserable lives under the thumb of Mayor Regina Mills. the former Evil Queen.

Twenty-eight years passed in this way with no hope in sight. It was not until the coming of Emma Swan, the prophecised Savior and secret daughter of Snow White and Prince Charming, that the curse was lifted. Mr. Gold, the former Rumplestiltskin, brought magic to Storybrooke around the same time, beginning a whole new series of adventures. Little did anyone know that the Ring of Truth was also in Storybrooke, it's powers reawakened by Mr. Gold. Who will find it and use it's power...and for what?
1451.title: Once Upon a Time

But quickly she smiled and "thanked" him for the information. She asked Gary ' Who is the one that wants me gone first.' He replied 'Rebecca...we can get her out first if you like.'

After another minute of talking, Annie pondered on what to do next and how much power from the Ring Of Truth to use without gaining too much suspicion of being lucky. After all, Annie could now read minds.

145332111111.title: Gary was lying to her.

choices: Change himself with it or use it to find food
Use it to try and easily acquire friends on the tribe
145332112.content:
Brandon couldn't have been more excited at the moment. Here he was, on the hit show Survivor. It was his dream come true. He had been placed on the Nevis tribe with four other guys and four women. He hadn't caught any of their names yet, due to the fact that they were just now entering their campsite.

Right off the bat one of the bigger, more muscly guys named Toby stepped up.

"Alright, I want to get this camp set up immediately. So I'll have Bobby, Daniel, and Steve help me with the shelter."

All the guys he called were also considerably stronger looking gentlemen. Brandon scratched the back of his head, which was covered in long, dirty blonde hair. He listened as Toby continued.

"Ok, the girls can go get some water or firewood or something... um..." Toby looked at Brandon with a questioning glance.

"Brandon, you wanna go look for some fruit or something?" Toby asked in a bored tone.

Brandon just nodded his head. He didn't want to get into an argument with anyone. So he headed out into the woods by himself. He examined the trees around him looking for any traces of fruit, and getting more and more disappointed with what he saw. Bowing his head in frustration, he then saw a small, shiny object sitting on the ground in front of him. He slowly picked it up, and looked around to see no camera crew or other contestants were near him yet. So he examined it, and for a moment thought it was something from Kay Jewelry. He tried guessing what the material was.

"Oh, I know what this is." He stated as he figured it was made from gold.

Just then, his brain was blasted with new information as he now actually knew what it was. The ring of truth. While in possession of it, whatever he said would become true. It had the power to manipulate reality itself.

With all the things he could do with it, Brandon decided to use it for personal gain in Survivor. Why? Because he loved Survivor (and because that's what this little thread of this story is about).

So now that he has found the all powerful game-changer, what is he going to do first?
145332112.title: Let Brandon find the ring

choices: The rock killed the chicken so that the tribe will have meat too.
It just grazed the chicken but it headed toward the camp.
1453321121.content:
Brandon said to nobody in particular ' I will find fruit on this island, plenty of it.' By this time, one of the camera crew came around the corner. Brandon waited for him to get closer before heading to 'find' fruit.

After a few minutes, Brandon saw a creek and an pear tree that was partly concealed behind some boulders. Brandon said ' I can climb this tree and get some fruit to feed us for a few meals. Brandon easily climbed the tree and plucked some fruit into a bag that he was carrying.

When Brandon felt that he found plenty of fruit, he climbed down to return to camp. On the way back,Brandon spotted a chicken eating some seed. Slowly Brandon picked up a rock and said quietly ' watch me hit the chicken'

Brandon threw the rock at the chicken and the rock made contact.
1453321121.title: Change himself with it or (use it to find food)

choices: Wish for more supplies or personal enhancements
14533211211.content:
The rock hit the head of the chicken with an audible WHACK!.

Brandon's face revealed a joyful, albeit a bit buffoonish grin. He pumped his fist in the air and looked over to the cameraman, who looked extremely impressed, but didn't say anything. Against the rules for the cameramen to talk and such. Brandon decided to share a few thoughts in interview form.

"Big guy over there doesn't think little ol' Brandon can help with the shelter, isn't fit for the athletic work? Welp, we'll see how macho man likes getting the scrawniest part of the chicken."

Brandon grabbed the chicken by the neck, and carried it along with the fruit back to the camp. He tried his best to conceal his joy in having procured a nice meal for the first day, maybe even the first two days... oh yeah, that and the magic ring with cosmic powers. He was a little happy about that, too.

As soon as he walked into camp, he spotted only one of the guys building the shelter. Daniel, maybe? Nobody else was around.

"Hey, where did everyone else go?" Brandon asked.

Daniel continued working on the shelter as he responded. "The other two guys went to go look for some more food. The girls are still out looking for firewood. Never would've expected them to take so long with it. Need somethin' to do?"

"No," Brandon stated as modestly as he could. "I was just wondering where I should put the chicken and fruit."

Daniel paused in his work and turned around to face Brandon, and his jaw dropped.

"DUDE! CHICKEN!" Daniel rushed over to Brandon, leaving his unfinished shelter as if it weren't even a concern. Brandon nodded vigorously, glad for the positive attention from a tribe mate.

"You are the MAN!" Daniel then cupped his hands over his mouth and screamed. "HEY Y'ALL, WE'RE HAVIN' KFC TONIGHT!"

The rest of the tribe came back in a span of five minutes, some carrying a few pieces of fruit, some carrying twigs, and all carrying astonished glances at the soon to be meal. Toby came forth and inspected the chicken.

"Danny boy, where did you manage to get this? I didn't even know chickens lived this far out in the jungle."

Brandon stepped forward alongside Toby.

"Actually, I caught it over there by the trail."

Toby turned in surprise, not even being aware of Brandon's presence before this encounter.

"Really?" Toby stood silent for a while, as if the new information blew him away. Then one of the girls walked up.

"That is awesome! You are great! By the way, we never really did a formal introduction. My name's Beverly, what's yours?"

"Brandon."

Brandon surveyed Beverly. She was about 5'5", about a foot shorter than him, and had short, dirty blonde hair. She seemed pretty athletic, had a bit of a "California surfer" accent, and was wearing khakis and a light blue tanktop.

Brandon and Bev shook hands, and then he found himself being introduced to all the other members of the tribe. After a few small conversations and a lot of praise, Brandon decided to tell everyone he was going back out to hunt for more food, but in actuality, he was going to get some more use out of his all powerful ring. Once he was gone, he noticed a camera man moving to follow him, so he made his wish quickly.
14533211211.title: The rock killed the chicken so that the tribe w...

to know what his tribe mates think of him
145332112111.title: Wish for more supplies or personal enhancements

"My tribe will win." Because, when life gives you lemons, you cheat.
1453321121112.content:
Brandon quietly whispered "I have the ability to know what my tribe mates are thinking." Then he slipped the ring off and put it back in his pocket as the cameramen came. He looked around and noticed that one of the guys, Bobby, the fat farmer from down south, was giving a confessional. He tried using his powers, and was able to listen to what Bobby was thinking/saying.

Bobby was praising the camp life and Brandon's chicken kill. "Who woulda guessed tha the city boy from up North could atually do somethin' li tha. This trahb migh atually be pretty darn good."

'Wow, it's a good thing I can get the gist of what he's saying, what with the accent and all.' Brandon thought. He surveyed the rest of his team. Most just thought about getting work done on the shelter, or getting food, or whatnot. Bev was also praising the great chicken hinter.

"How cool is this guy. He's this scrawny, pale dude that reminds me of Slender Man at first, and he's out in the jungle for like three minutes and brings back this chicken. It's unbelievable. Our tribe doesn't have a single weak link, except for maybe Yvonne."

Yvonne, a Russian-American woman in her early 40's, was on the chubbier side, but still seemed pretty strong. She didn't talk too much, and seemed to be a bit of an outsider.

After a little bit of searching he 'found' some bananas and decided to head back to camp. On his way back, he decided to give a confessional, and used some of his psychic abilities to start talking about his tribe mates.

"Bev and Bobby both seem to be getting a lot of work done on the shelter. Steve and Danny Boy aren't getting that much done with the fire, but bless em for trying. Jo and Nikki," Brandon referred to the athletic African American woman and the skinny Hispanic woman, "are getting supplies for the fire and shelter, they seem alright. I dunno what Toby and Yvonne are doing, I think she's trying to go get food too, maybe? As for Toby-"

"HEY GUYS! WE GOT TREE MAIL!"

Brandon looked away from the camera to see Toby coming into camp with a note. Everyone dropped what they were doing to go to Toby.

"Quicker than a fish, stronger than a bull,
miss a few shots and you'll look like a fool.
Immunity is what you seek in the shape of a tome,
be on the losing tribe and you may be sent home."

Toby looked up.

"So who's our strong swimmers?"

Nikki, Jo, Bev, and Daniel raised their hands.

"Alright, it also says strong as a bull. Who's up for that?"

Steve, Bobby, Yvonne, and Toby raised their respective hands.

"Also says something about good aiming or targeting. Hey Chicken Killer, wanna step up?"

Brandon grinned at his new title and nodded enthusiastically, receiving a hard but loving slap on the back from Daniel.

The tribe grabbed their flag and headed out, but not before Brandon said one last thing into the ring.
1453321121112.title: Mr. Psychic

choices: Brandon's tribe does terrible, he didn't get to even participate
His tribe does good, Brandon does great
14533211211121.content:
After whispering his wish, he left his ring behind in his bag and walked with the rest of the tribe to the challenge.
____________________________________________________________________________ ____________

Jeff stood in between the two tribes, Nevis on one side, Yang Lain on the other. Jeff then asked some questions.

"Man in the shades and white wife-beater, what's your name?"

The man from Yang Lain was a buff Caucasian American with short blonde hair and a cheeky grin plastered on his face.

"Marty." The man said with a slight hint of a New England accent.

"Marty, how's your camp life been?"

"Pretty good, we got a fire started and everything."

Jeff nodded and turned towards the Nevis tribe. "How about you guys? Girl in front with the khakis. How's your camp?"

"Pretty good. We don't have fire yet, but when we do, we'll have plenty of water, warmth, and chicken."

Jeff nodded and went to start talking, but then did a double take. "Chicken?"

Daniel started laughing and slapped his hand onto Brandon's shoulder. "Colonel Sanders over here killed one earlier today."

Jeff looked dumbfounded. "Colonel Sanders, anything to add."

Brandon just shook his head and smiled. He cast a quick glance over at the other tribe. Some looked at him in awe, while others looked skeptical. Jeff decided to start talking about the rules.

"Alright. For this challenge, you'll divide into two groups of four and one group of one. The first group will be the swimmers, who'll swim out over there." he pointed out a ways into the ocean to eight rafts that each carried objects. "You'll drag those back. Once all four rafts have been brought back, the four strong members will be given the task of hoisting up the cargo. Glass tiles. You'll be hoisting them using a rope and they'll hang from a horizontal pole twenty feet from the ground. The last person will use rocks to try and break the windows from ten yards away. There are two catches. If any of the strong members drop their windows at any time, they will have to drag the window back to the shore line and then back to the pole. These are heavy windows. Also, the thrower will be blindfolded."

Brandon grimaced, but inwardly felt safe knowing about the wish he had made. He shook off his negative look and put on a smile. He wanted to look competitive for his tribe.

Jeff finished his guidelines. "I'll give you guys a minute to get arranged, and then we'll begin."
14533211211121.title: Mr. Sanders

145332112111211.content:
The last thing Brandon saw was Bev, Danny, Nikki, and Jo going to the starting line before he put on his blindfold. He heard Probst scream "Go!" and then all he could do was listen to the commentary by the host.

"Jo, Danny, and Jerry out to their rafts first, having to untie the knots at the bottom before they can start pulling!"
...
"Harold and Nikki at the back. The oldest man and the youngest woman being the slowest swimmers!"
...
"Jerry and Danny both have their rafts untied, heading back. Everyone working on their knots now except for Nikki. She is STILL struggling out in the water."

'Oh man. It's one thing to be failing at the challenge. Now she has to listen to a fifty year old host heckle her, too.' Brandon decided to give her some positive reinforcement. He would've given her a ring-power up, but he had foolishly left the ring back at camp.

"You got this Nikki!" Brandon shouted. This was followed by shouts of encouragement from his teammates.

"Nikki finally gets to her raft. Everyone has untied theirs except for her and Harold, who also seems to be struggling a bit. Bev, Jayson, and Manoj having trouble getting the rafts back. They are heavy windows!"
...
Brandon grimaced nervously. Jeff stopped talking. He decided to ask Bobby what was happening.

"Well, all but them two out there are gettin to shore. Ah think we gotta have all our raffs up here fore we cin do anything."

"Ah. Alright."

Jeff then continued his commentary.

"Harold FINALLY gets through his rope and is carrying the rafts back. Nikki, costing her team valuable time."
...
"Jerry and Danny back with their rafts. Jo back! Kim is back! Manoj, Bev, and Jayson are back. Harold, trying to strengthen the lead."

Brandon rubbed his forehead, and heard some of the tribe sigh. 'I'd hate to be her right now.' he thought.
...
"Nikki done with her knots! She is now swimming back. Harold now getting to shore! YANG LAIN! Get your windows hung!"

"DAMNIT!" Brandon figured it was Toby who swore. He waited for Probst to scream for them to go, but first he heard a loud CRASH!

"Yang Lain, first window down. Lex aiming for her second."

Brandon smirked as he thought of a way to slow them. "Bobby, tell me when she's about to throw again. Quietly."
...
"Now."

"MISS!" Brandon screeched as loud as he could. He waited a second and heard a curse or two from the other tribe.

"Sorry. Stepped on something sharp and screamed." Brandon hid his smirk, though he heard Bobby and Toby laughing. He thought he might have even heard Yvonne giggle.

Jeff didn't pay them any attention. "Nikki is back! Go Nevis! YOU'RE STILL IN THIS!"

CRASH! CRASH!

"Two more windows! Lex only has one left!"

Brandon heard grunting, and grabbed a rock from the pile. 'Time to see what I'm made of.' He thought to himself. He waited for the call that the windows were hung. But a different sound came first.

CRASH!

"Yang Lain, WINS IMMUNITY AND FLINT!"

Brandon dropped his rock as he heard the other tribe cheer. He didn't even want to take his blindfold off. 'This is what I get for not just having us win.' He stood back with his tribe as they watched the opposing team get the immunity stature. He dismissed them after tossing them flint. He then turned to Nevis.

"Nevis, got nothing for you. I'll see you tonight at tribal council."

They headed back to camp.
145332112111211.title: Mr. Useless

1453321121112111.content:
Brandon walked back to camp with his tribemates. He was in a rather somber mood, but was far less concerned than the rest of them. True, he didn't compete in the challenge, and some of his tribemates didn't think he was too physically strong, but he had something to ensure safety. The ring.

'It should be right where I left it.' He thought as he went right for his bag. He reached in while Nikki made a big speech about how she was sorry for blowing the swimming portion. His hand moved around a bit, but he couldn't find anything.

'Oh no... oh crap.'

He lost the ring! How could this have happened! He looked back to the rest of his tribe, and saw that most of them were hugging Nikki.

'Oh great, my reality altering relic isn't here, and any of these guys could've taken it!' he thought frantically. 'No, no. Nobody would just take it. I just need to be cool, and try to find it later. Right now, I need to make sure I'm safe.'

He walked over and gave Nikki a hug as well, and then stated he was going to go to the woods to look for more food and wood for their non-existent fire.

"Get us another chicken Colonel!" Dan shouted.

When Brandon thought he was far enough away, he decided to read some of his tribemates' minds, and who there vote was for. After a bit, Brandon got that Bev, Danny, and Bobby were voting for Nikki, as she had cost them in the challenge. Jo and Nikki were voting for... him? They thought he was physically weaker than anyone, (which wasn't wrong), and that he didn't even participate in the challenge.

Toby was also leaning towards voting for Brandon, mainly for the physical reason. Steve hadn't given the vote any thought, but was awfully close with Toby. That left one person who might be the swing vote. Yvonne. If he had any hope for feeling safe tonight, he'd have to get Yvonne with him.

He decided to help her throughout the day, getting wood for the fire with her, helping her and the guys refine the shelter, and trying to strike up conversations with her. It seemed to be going alright, but Yvonne didn't ever really talk back. Most of the time, she just worked without even acknowledging his presence. He tried reading her mind, but it was never on the vote, or anybody on her tribe.

He did, however, get some new thoughts from Toby, who was giving a confessional.

Toby: "That Brandon guy. I think he knows he's in trouble. He knows he's getting at least four votes. Mine, Nikki, Jo, and Steve. I dunno if he knows yet that I can get Danny Boy and Bev to vote with me. After that, we'll be six strong and we can run this thing. He's busy wasting his time on Yvonne."

Brandon saw the sun beginning to set, and decided he had two choices left. He didn't have enough time to find the ring, so he could either talk to Yvonne about the vote, or get in better with Danny and Bev.
1453321121112111.title: Mr. Persuasive

choices: After some discussion, they decided on Toby

Danny laughed ' Want to join our side. Don't worry. You're cool.' Bev winked when Danny said that.

Miss Glenda Duckson graduated from Dartmouth University-cum laude. She was pretty and extremely talented. But finding a good teaching job was hard but this was the best she could find.

A few days ago, her eccentric next door neighbor gave her a ring that was claimed to be powerful and magical. Her neighbor said that the ring may give her an extra edge in school. ' Just think smart and wish for something.'

The school was basically run by the local gang the Jets. Although another gang called the Stingers was giving them trouble.
Glenda tried out the ring by first wishing for a delicious hotdog. When the hotdog materialized and she ate it, she next wished for the washing machine to be repaired. Almost instantly, it was fixed. She was now convinced of its power.

The first day of school arrived. She wondered how much of an impression to make. She first made herself fairly 'hot'. with her next wish Then she gave herself a body of a female bodybuilder. Then she smiled.

Glenda said to herself ' This may make an impression on the class on their first day here.'

The first 4 who came in were the serious students who cared for the school. The rest of the class came in at the last minute, including the 'ringleader' of the class, Gregg.

16 years old Lori Coleman was a bit nervous but knew some things from child psychologists and hints from her own mother. Money was tight and she needed the money. Fortunately, she knew some cooking skills and some cleaning skills. But she was just 5 feet 5 inches tall.
She found the ring at a garage sale the day before for $5 dollars and thought it was pretty. She put it on her finger before she left home.

The boy that she was going to babysit was a brat. But she was determined to do a good job. She went to her bicycle but noticed that it has a flat on the front tire.

She moaned OH DEAR, I wish that tire was good as new. Suddenly the tire repaired itself.

She was amazed. "Did I just do that?" Testing it again, she said ' My bike is brand new' Then her 'old' bike was brand new, sparkling and pretty. Lori smiled 'Wow, maybe it is my ring. Well, I better get going for my babysitting job.'

Lori soon arrived at the Landers's house. The mom answered the door, feeling tired. But the mom smiled ' Glad that you are here. My son, Charles, can be a handful even though he is just 6 years old. Do you think that you can handle him?

Feeling confident, Lori said Yes, I can handle him.

Then the mom said ' Well then, I do have some errands to run. Good luck. Charles, be nice to your babysitter--Bye.'

info.brief_description: Everything you say is true when you hold the ring.
info.description:
The ring of Truth is a mysterious object of near infinite power. Whoever wears it will be able to make whatever they say true and you get to choose the owner. Basically an anything goes story with only a few rules:
1. No gore, graphic sex, or character death.
2. The ring can not be taken from whoever finds it. Only they can choose to give the ring up.
Other than that, have fun and go crazy! This is based on another interactive I encountered at bearchive BTW.
